comment: I made a rate my professor account just to let people know not to take her class. She is unfair with grading and her lectures has nothing to do with the test. She doesn't prepare you enough for her test. Doesn't respond to emails when questioning her about grades either.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Gillette is probably the worst professor I have taken all of college. I understand that this is a hard subject, but she moves at the speed of lightning in class. She makes you feel dumb for asking questions and asking for help. Only thing in the grade book is the 4 tests. Dont take her if you can avoid it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: i dont think i learned anything from her this semester, it was easier to just read textbook and notes online lol. this class is difficult so i wouldnt recommend to choose her as your professor. only good thing is she gives extra credit and your lowest test grade gets replaced with final to help tour grade a little

Go to class and it's still hard to pass. I made a Rate My Professor Account just to warn of how bad she is. Her tests are nothing like class and are seriously hard to prepare for. She does not care about your grade at all. She had on average 3-4 errors per test. The only reason we found them was because she reviewed them for the final. Be aware.

Had to take her class online. Wow. Horrible teacher that does not care about your grade or if you learn. Lectures match almost nothing on the tests. 4 tests for 75% of your grade. Project for 15%. Final for 10%. Had errors on every single test that she only corrected when called out. Released final grades than had to revise bec her final had errors
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Literally came here before the semester started to see student reviews & dont procrastinate & by procrastinate I mean registering to find professors for this class because she isnt it. Not very pleasant to reach out to and if you dont get something after she explains it once good luck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Can't read her handwriting at all. You have to be super dedicated to do well in this class. I took her online. All hard exams even though they are open note. I know there's much better professors to take. Not really a nice person either

Awful. Never had a worse teacher. Tests are actually RIDICULOUS, one exam contained 6 chapters of heavy material. You only have 1 hr 20 min to answer math questions that take close to 30 minutes to do. If you have other classes you care about, DO NOT take her! Impossible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Easily the worst 3000 level professor I have ever had. Her grading consists of three exams and a final, so good luck passing if you bomb one of them. She teaches on Zoom, and writes out problems with her mouse on her computer. It is extremely hard to follow, and she does not go over her exams in class. I would take any other professor possible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Tests do not reflect any of the material that was 'taught' over the course of the semester. The conceptual questions she gives are things we never even talked about! Also doesn't know how to work technology so all of the grading was constantly messed up. There are probably way better options to take for this class - this was not the move.
Yo just do yourself a favor and don't take this woman

Not a good teacher. Gives random multiple choice on tests that everyone struggles with that we havent gone over all semester. She refuses to let students use a note card for formulas. She makes the class way harder than it needs to be.

Basic lectures, not engaging. She begins a new concept with very difficult first-time examples. Feels threatened if a student questions her. Capital budgeting project is grading very harshly. She gives you chances to bring your grade. Overall, she is a basic boring professor.

Very tough class that took me a ton of effort to understand. However, Dr. Gillette is a great professor. She gives a ton of partial credit if you thoroughly attempt the problems and wants her students to succeed. The lectures can be boring but if you pay attention and go to each class you should be fine. Do not fall behind though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The class is tough, get a financial cal from the start. Flies through important material. In the beginning there are practice and example problems which are helpful. Towards the end that dies off. Practice the past exams (she'll trip you up with wording tho) Do the problem of day even if it is wrong you'll get a 100 (they add up)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Takes personal issues out on your grade. Because of the imbalance of power, you're not in the position to remedy misunderstandings by acknowledging it and moving on. She'll literally circle a blank spot on your test, deduct points, and then not remember why she did it. She'll keep you from an A if she can. This is a poor institution...

Although the professor knows her stuff, she is not good at relaying information to students. She is not able to explain concepts in more than one way and assumes students have knowledge they may not. Worked hard and only managed a C.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Knows what she is talking about, but has no idea how to explain it to people who don't. If you aren't a math person, don't take her.

She is very mono-toned. She expects you to know the material. Get ready to spend 40 plus minutes going over one problem. Gives out practice quizzes and exams but are no where near the same as the actual test. No homework. She is hardly available outside the class.

Establishes authority at the beginning of the semester by insulting the class. Rather than take responsibility for her teaching she blames the class. You must interact with her with an excessive amount of deference. Behaviors that show her that you are lower. Will compromise your grade if she feels you are too confident. Will find this a threat.

Do not take her! She is friendly to begin with, but is condescending when answering questions, doesn't answer emails over the weekend, and will fly through important material without stopping. She can be very rude if you catch her on a bad day. Tests and quizzes aren't too bad if you come to class and pay attention. Would not recommend to anyone.

Big and complicated capital budgeting project. It involves coming up with a new product line for an existing firm. You will have several spreadsheets for your cashflows. An overall feeling of helplessness came over my teammates and it was very hard to pull them out of it. Had to ask my parents for help and they were surprised by the assignment.

Mrs. Gillette is the worst teacher I have ever taken!  Her tests are insanely hard because the problems you practice in class are way easier than what she puts on the test so you aren't prepared.  She gave us "great work" and "good job" feedback on our project and then proceeded to fail us and yell at one of my groupmates when asked what we did

terrible teacher!!!! avoid at all costs!! She seems nice enough at first but you will soon find out you made a mistake! she gets angry when you ask questions, is terrible at explaining the information, and she stands in front of the work she writes on the board so you cannot see any of it.

She's a great professor. The book is not needed, as everything you need to know for quizzes and exams are covered in class. She uses her powerpoints each class and walks through example problems almost exactly like what you will see on quizzes and exams. She is nice too, my grade turned out to be 89.3% and she gave me an A. I'd take her again!

Dr. Gillette was a decently nice professor. However, she just stands at the board in front of her own work. She will ask for questions but gets very condescending when answering them. Her tests and quizzes are moderately difficult. Do not take unless you have a lot of time dedicated to this class. I did not do well when taking 4 other classes

How the class was graded: 25% first exam, 25% second exam, 25% final exam, 2 quizzes each worth 10% and 5% for homework that is done using an online resource. she doesnt curve.                        Over all the class was moderatley difficult. The concepts required practice (repetition) to understand so redo the examples used in class.
Very intelligent professor with great understanding on the world of finance and banking. I really enjoyed her class!
She is a good professor! She knows her stuff and knows how to explain it so you can understand. She is willing to help you as long as you ask.

She is a great prof! I had no interest in finance before her class and am now changing my major! She is intelligent, happy, nice, approachable, and has a great teaching style with fair tests. Go to class, ask questions, work the problems she does in class and if you are good at math you wont have to study at all! Defiantly recommend her!
talk about Easy A. not the best teacher but you will get an A

Dr. Gillette is a great teacher. She is very nice, fair, and helpful. If you put in a little effort, this class is very easy. Tests are not hard and very similar to (and usually easier than) problems worked in class. I would definitely recommend this professor.

I thought she was great.  The subject matter is pretty tough but if you do her recommended problems and read the book, you'll do fine.  I didn't see her get annoyed with questions like others are saying, on the contrary, she was quite helpful and enthusiastic.  She gives partial credit on tests, but they're no cakewalk either.
This class is for finance professors not finance students. She moves through course material faster than you can understand, tests and fails you just as fast. SHE IS TOO FAST.

I would not recommend taking this teacher for this class unless you are already a finance wiz!  This teacher moves way too fast in lectures and is annoyed by questions.  Her tests are extremely hard, although she will give partial credit.  I just felt I came out of the class having learned nothing & hating finance! Don't recommend at all!
Very difficult class, with the material.  The professor speaks very quickly and can be quite difficult to follow.  You will not get much from class, most of your training will come from the textbook,
uncooperative and moody
Be carefull.... She run in the class. She only use power point so be ready to take notes..if you can. Test are hard.

She moves through the material quickly and for whatever reason, is fixed on the use of equations instead of todays technology.  Her test are difficult, yet my class impressed her to the point where she made our final optional.  I had Thompkins the previous semester(dropped), so I can say the Gillete is easier, and Thompkins is more intense.

This professor is extremely unclear when giving out lectures. Moves simply too fast for a normal person to stay focused in this class. Her tests 4 Show your work questions and about 17 multiple choice. Tests are moderately hard. This professor sucks pretty much and I'd not recommend her.

ALL I HAVE TO SAY IS YOU BETTER GO TO CLASS EVERYDAY AND TAKE NOTES; GOOD NOTES ON THE MATH PROBLEMS SHE DO. ALSO WHEN SHE GIVES YOU HOMEWORK STUDY IT FOR THE TEST ALONG WITH OTHER MATERIALS. TRY TO GET THE STUDY GUIDE IT HELPS SOMEWHAT. EVENTHOUGH SHE CAN BE TOUGH SHE DOES CARE. GO TO HER OFFICE SHE'S A LOT NICER OUT OF CLASS.

Dr. Gillette used mainly PPT from the authors of the text and some pages had wrong information on them. Seemed be bothered by questions that got her out of her read from PPT presentation. Need to read the text and study PPT for exams

She asks if you have questions and then gets annoyed when you do.  Her goal is not to teach finance but rather to delight in how much you don't know in comparisson with herself.  Teaches straight from the book and nothing else.
